intro: Anaphalis kashmiriana, commonly known as the Kashmirian plume-vine, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant features silver-gray foliage with soft, woolly textures, and its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, resembling plumes. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
